meta.name: description
meta.content: Tulia ISD is a public school district in Tulia, Texas serving grades K-12.

nav.a: Campus, District, and State Report Cards

div.p: Hornet Football fires up the Dobbers at the junior high pep rally.

div.span: Governor Abbott announced April 17th that public schools will remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. TISD will continue remote learning activities through May 21. Stay safe.

img.alt: Fill Out Your 2020 Census Thumbnail Image

article.div: Let’s count all kids! The census helps local governments plan for the future and determines the level of federal funding for programs for young children, including our schools, child care, housing, public transportation, and health care. Fill out the census today at my2020census.gov

img.alt: Gov. Abbott Announced School Closure Through End of Year Thumbnail Image

h1.a: Gov. Abbott Announced School Closure Through End of Year

article.div: Governor Abbott announced today that public schools will remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. TISD will continue remote learning activities through May 21. Stay safe.

h1.a: Change to Campus Grading Policies for 6th Six Weeks

article.div: Due to the transition to distance learning, each campus has refined their grading policies for the 6th Six Weeks grading period. Click the link below for more information from each campus.

The Tulia ISD Hall of Fame selection committee has decided to cancel the 2020 Hall of Fame induction scheduled for May 11, 2020. Persons nominated in 2020 will be considered by the committee in Spring 2021, as will all other nominees who are eligible for consideration at that time. This decision was made in response to the COVID-19 pandemic and many factors were considered. The committee extends appreciation to those who submitted nominations and to all who support this positive event for our school district and community.
The General Election on May 2, 2020 has been postponed, please click the headline to read more.
